Description: Rim and neck fragment of pottery krater; solid zigzag pattern on top of rim; on the outside of neck a running ivy leaf pattern in dull brown, partly fired red. Micaceous orange clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 135, no. 382, pl. XL)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 238, no. 248)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.726)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5722 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
